div.a: POSTPONED AT THIS TIME- NEW DATES TO BE DETERMINED- Kindergarten Registration

span.p: Students must be age 5 by October 1, 2020 to enter
Kindergarten
Registration Packets are available for download: Click Here for Packet
or in person at
The Lyndhurst Board of Education located at 420 Fern Avenue between the
hours of 8:30 A.M. – 3:00 P.M.

p.span: Information regarding PreK will be forthcoming.

span.p: April 19, 2020
Dear Lyndhurst School Community:

a.title: Click to read more about: School Closure Update- 4/19/20

img.alt: Read more about this news article

div.a: Township of Lyndhurst Fundraiser- Leave your Place/Cover your Face

em.span: Please see message below and two attachments for township fundraiser:

span.p: East Coast Designs, a local vendor who has long time serviced our Lyndhurst first responders and recreational programs, has launched a custom web based store to purchase
“We are Lyndhurst” custom face masks.

The purpose of this initiative is to establish town pride and unity during this unprecedented time, while raising money for our food pantry parallel with awareness and compliance with the CDC recommendation to wear cloth facial coverings in high transmission areas.

b.u: A portion of the funds for every mask purchased will be donated to the Lyndhurst Food Bank!

span.p: This online store has additional design options available, and their purchase will also go towards this fund raising goal.
See below for the link to the Online Store:
1. Click Link
2. Find Lyndhurst
3. Click on “GO”
Hello, "Class of 2020" Students & Parents!
We hope this email finds everyone safe, healthy and practicing social distancing.

As graduation approaches it is a Lyndhurst tradition to display "lawn signs" in support of our graduates. Although, this year is definitely different than previous years - it's not going to stop us from celebrating our students. Normally, orders would be placed through your graduation committee but due to our unique circumstances accepting orders is a bit challenging this year. However, never fear MAIL DIRECT is here! Mail Direct has graciously offered to handle all orders, payments, and notify parents when signs are ready for pick-up. To place your "Class of 2020" Lawn Sign order simply contact MAIL DIRECT by:
*Email: michele@callmdpc.com (subject line: Lawn Sign Order)
*Form: Complete the attached form in link below, and email it to michele@callmdpc.com
*ORDERS DUE BY: FRIDAY, MAY 15, 2020 (no extensions) Orders will be ready by the first or second week in June.
Any questions or concerns regarding lawn signs should be directed to Mail Direct at 201-933-2782.
Sincerely,
The LHS "Class of 2020" Project Graduation Committee

span.strong: SCHOOL CLOSURE UPDATE- 3/29/20- Click on read more below

a.title: Click to read more about: School Closure Update- 3/29/20

img.alt: Read more about this news article

span.p: Please see the attached letter in the link below with information about the recently released 2018-19 New Jersey School Performance Reports.

p.span: Please see attached presentation in the link below:

div.a: School Closure Update- 3/24/2020/Actualización del cierre de la escuela- 24/03/20

p.span: Please see school closure update in the link below:

span.span: Actualización del cierre de la escuela- 24/03/20

div.a: School Closure- Board of Education Office Hours

p.span: The Lyndhurst School District's central/board of education office will not be open to the public, except for emergency situations, based on social distancing guidelines that the district will be following. Essential employees will be present in the board of education office and available.The preferred method is to reach out to us at 201-438-5683, or e-mail us at boardoffice@lyndhurst.k12.nj.us for general questions from now until March 27th. We will be sending out updates about this evolving situation as we get them.
Additionally, please note that our school buildings will be completely closed to the public, as per recommendation.
Please stay safe and reach out to any of us if you have a question or concern.

div.a: 2nd REVISED- School Breakfast and Lunch for Eligible Students (Free/Reduced)

p.span: During the upcoming closure, the Lyndhurst School District has coordinated a plan with its food service provider, Mascio’s, offering cold “Grab and Go” meals to eligible students (free/reduced).

These meals can be picked up outside the high school cafeteria entrance, behind the bleachers closest to the high school. The HS parking lot will be open on Fern Avenue. Pick up time for breakfast and lunch will be between 9:00-11:00 AM.

div.a: 2º REVISADO- Desayuno y almuerzo escolar para estudiantes elegibles (Gratis / Reducido)

pre.span:
Durante el próximo cierre, el Distrito Escolar de Lyndhurst ha coordinado un plan con su proveedor de servicios de alimentos, Mascio, que ofrece comidas frías "Grab and Go" a estudiantes elegibles (gratis / reducido).
Estas comidas se pueden recoger afuera de la entrada de la cafetería de la escuela secundaria, detrás de las gradas más cercanas a la escuela secundaria. El estacionamiento de HS estará abierto en Fern Avenue. La hora de recogida para el desayuno y el almuerzo será entre las 9: 00-11: 00 a.m.

span.p: Please see the important letter regarding the 2020 Census. Click here.
Dear Lyndhurst Community:
Please click on the link below to view the Mutual Emergency Response Plan, created by the Superintendents of the South Bergen Jointure Commission.

div.a: Congratulations Alex Ryabenkov - NJSMA North Jersey Intermediate Region I Band Member

span.p: Alex Ryabenkov is a 9th-grade tuba player for the Lyndhurst High School marching and concert bands. Alex recently auditioned for the NJSMA North Jersey Intermediate Region I Band and was accepted.
He will perform in concert at Madison Jr. School, Madison, NJ, on Sunday, March 8, 2020, at 3:00 PM.
